Title: Data Analyst
Company: Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company
Description:
Company Overview

Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company delivers affordable, high-performance space systems for exacting customers. At Millennium, you will be part of a close-knit team working on exciting technological problems. We work in an open environment where ideas are shared across all disciplines, and there are ample opportunities for advancement based on excellence. Superstars are welcome.

At Millennium, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity, and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Job Summary

The Data Analyst will collect data, lead analyses, and develop strategies to drive efficiency at Millennium Space Systems. As a member of a small, agile team, they will have opportunities to contribute directly to projects that will help Millennium Space Systems achieve its long term manufacturing goals. Potential applications include identifying methods for measuring and monitoring core company metrics; analyzing data to optimize current manufacturing/supply processes; constructing and maintaining data pipelines from multiple systems; and utilizing historical manufacturing data to help generate forward forecasts.

This position’s internal job code is Business Intelligence Analyst. Our team is currently hiring for level range of 2-3.

Job Responsibilities

Collect, validate, and analyze data to support internal stakeholders and Millennium’s customers
Create and manage data workflows in order to increase data accessibility and streamline company reporting capabilities
Leverage data to support the development and continuous improvement of manufacturing processes
Develop Key Performance Indicators and report them periodically to stakeholders
Develop models of processes, and use those models to inform decision-making at Millennium
Build forecasts to aid Millennium in planning and executing our work


Minimum Qualifications

Two years of professional experience in analytical roles
Knowledge of Transact-SQL (and SQL Server)
Working knowledge of at least one programming language for data analysis, such as R, Python (including NumPy, pandas, and scikit-learn), or Julia
Familiarity with statistical methods, including time series forecasting and regression analysis
Experience interacting with and manipulating relational datasets
Experience leading at least one data-driven project with multiple stakeholders
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Detail oriented and highly organized
Self-starter and a team player


Preferred Qualifications

Five or more years of professional experience in analytical roles, including but not limited to Operations Research or Data Science; or Master’s Degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics or a related field
Experience working with API interfaces
Knowledge of multiple programming languages
Familiarity with optimization techniques and experience in formulating optimization problems
Experience working in an advanced manufacturing environment and/or government contracting


Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only of what is reasonably expected to be paid for the position. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary Pay-Range

Level 2: $75,650 - $111,250
Level 3: $94,350 - $138,750


Benefits And Perks

Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company offers a very competitive benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, and 401k plan.

Before applying, please note:

Millennium is DDTC-registered, ITAR-compliant Company. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Applicants MUST be U.S. citizens and eligible for a security clearance. Additionally, applicants must be willing to apply for and maintain a security clearance. We are proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage veterans, disabled veterans and disabled individuals to apply for any open position for which they feel they are qualified.

Applicant Privacy Policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our large retail client is looking for a data analyst to join their team on a long-term W2 contract (12+ months). The data analyst will be responsible for interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques.




Candidates must be willing to commute to Irving, TX 3 days a week. All McKinley roles include a competitive benefits package.




Responsibilities

Perform data cleaning, data modeling, data crunching, and data analysis using SQL
Develop visuals and interactive reports using power BI
Analyze mobile app data to understand user engagement and retention
Utilize Excel techniques like pivot table, and V-Lookup for analyzing data
Supporting product teams through both ad-hoc requests and planned projects
Analyze customer data for new opportunities, providing customized reporting and recommendations
Conduct quantitative analysis (ROI, identification and assessment of opportunities and risk, forecasting, and more)
Perform A/B testing, test vs control analysis, market basket analysis




Requirements

Bachelor's degree
Strong background in SQL, power BI, data analysis and statistical concepts
Strong analytics background with mobile applications using Mixpanel or other tools.
Experience using Excel (i.e., pivots, VLOOKUP’s, etc) and PowerPoint ( i.e., charts, graphs)
Understanding of analytics concepts: Test and Control methodology (sales data analysis, loyalty program analytics, customer segmentation, descriptive analysis, cohort analysis, offers/promotions data trend analysis (coupons, bonus offers, rewards, member offers)
Statistical Concepts (probability distributions, confidence intervals, statistical inference, mean, mode, median, hypothesis tests)

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI, SQL)
Description:
Job Description:

Create and maintain Power BI reports and Dashboards upon gathering the requirements from various stakeholders.
Make changes to the existing Power BI Reports and Dashboards on a regular basis as per requests from Business.
Work in a Power BI environment to create dashboards like daily, weekly, monthly reports using Power BI desktop and publish them to server.
Create complex Stored Procedures, triggers, cursors, tables, views, SQL joins and statements for applications by using T-SQL.
Ensure data completeness, data quality by validating that all records, all fields and the full contents of each field are loaded.
Design Cubes with Star Schema using SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS). Created several Dashboards and Scorecards with Key Performance Indicators (KPI) in SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
Work on troubleshooting ADF pipeline issues when needed

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TruConnect is on a mission to bridge the digital divide in the United States by delivering premium wireless services to underserved communities. We have connected millions of Americans over the past decade and experiencing substantial growth as the government places significant resources to help bridge the digital divide.

The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, well-organized, creative, empathetic, and proactive. You build trust & strong relationships at all levels. You are confident and can influence without formal authority, pushing back when appropriate. You earn respect and respect contributions of others.

 




DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

Demonstrable experience of using relational databases and Cloud Data environments via writing performant queries in SQL against multi-terabyte and billion row datasets in AWS Redshift/Spectrum, MS SQL, and MySQL
Transform data-based observations and insights into hypotheses through analytical rigor, leading to use cases that will confirm or deny those hypotheses and ultimately improve the quality of data
Demonstrate critical thinking around business rules and logic especially as it pertains to compensation models and other analytic models
Design appropriate data structures by gathering data from primary and secondary sources for reporting consumption
Troubleshoot, research, and identify discrepancies specifically around data such as inventory, compensation, claims/reimbursements, general sales activity, and other such related data
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Create structured data marts for current and historical reporting
Detail oriented and deadline driven to meet monthly filing deadlines
Assist in data governance, meta data management and quality control of the completeness and accuracy of data
Work with end users to follow through with associated action items and execute in a timely manner
Design and document process and data flows for establishing data pipelines to support detailed analyses and accuracy in reporting
Present analyses, translate findings in the data into solutions, and perform root cause analysis in a concise manner which is easy to interpret and understand

 

 

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

Bachelor’s degree is required. A degree in economics, finance, computer science, statistics, or other data related field preferred
Experience working with ETL tools such as Matillion, AWS Glue, SSIS, etc.
Working knowledge of BI reporting tools such as Tableau or similar tools
Strong product development mindset and focus on actionable analytics
Ability to clearly communicate with cross functional teams
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Translate business requirements into technical requirements
Work with business stakeholders to assess potential risks
Minimum of 2 years of BI/reporting/data analysis experience
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills
Analyze problems and provide automated solutions whenever possible
Working knowledge and experience with Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle
Experience with online collaboration tools such as Slack, JIRA, or MS Teams is a plus
Consistent demonstration of organization, prioritization, self-motivation, and problem resolution skills
Ability to navigate between multiple projects, meet deadlines, and process ad hoc requests
Ability to deal with ambiguity and influence change in a rapidly changing business environment
Great interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to provide insights to support key business decision making
MUST be able to work from the Los Angeles Office 3-4 days/week

 

BENEFITS:

401(k) matching
Medical insurance, including PPO & HSA
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Flexible Spending Account(s)
Free Life & Long-Term Disability Insurance
Free Identity Theft Protection & Travel Assistance
Access to corporate discount program
Flexible schedule
Paid time off (sick, bereavement, and Flex PTO)
Parental leave

TruConnect is on a mission to bridge the digital divide in the United States by delivering premium wireless services to underserved communities. We have connected millions of Americans over the past decade and experiencing substantial growth as the government places significant resources to help bridge the digital divide.

The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, well-organized, creative, empathetic, and proactive. You build trust & strong relationships at all levels. You are confident and can influence without formal authority, pushing back when appropriate. You earn respect and respect contributions of others.

 


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  • Demonstrable experience of using relational databases and Cloud Data environments via writing performant queries in SQL against multi-terabyte and billion row datasets in AWS Redshift/Spectrum, MS SQL, and MySQL
  • Transform data-based observations and insights into hypotheses through analytical rigor, leading to use cases that will confirm or deny those hypotheses and ultimately improve the quality of data
  • Demonstrate critical thinking around business rules and logic especially as it pertains to compensation models and other analytic models
  • Design appropriate data structures by gathering data from primary and secondary sources for reporting consumption
  • Troubleshoot, research, and identify discrepancies specifically around data such as inventory, compensation, claims/reimbursements, general sales activity, and other such related data
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Create structured data marts for current and historical reporting
  • Detail oriented and deadline driven to meet monthly filing deadlines
  • Assist in data governance, meta data management and quality control of the completeness and accuracy of data
  • Work with end users to follow through with associated action items and execute in a timely manner
  • Design and document process and data flows for establishing data pipelines to support detailed analyses and accuracy in reporting
  • Present analyses, translate findings in the data into solutions, and perform root cause analysis in a concise manner which is easy to interpret and understand

 

 

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Translate business requirements into technical requirements
  • Work with business stakeholders to assess potential risks
  • Minimum of 2 years of BI/reporting/data analysis experience
  • Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills
  • Analyze problems and provide automated solutions whenever possible
  • Working knowledge and experience with Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle
  • Experience with online collaboration tools such as Slack, JIRA, or MS Teams is a plus
  • Consistent demonstration of organization, prioritization, self-motivation, and problem resolution skills
  • Ability to navigate between multiple projects, meet deadlines, and process ad hoc requests
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and influence change in a rapidly changing business environment
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to provide insights to support key business decision making

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About You




You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.




If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!




About Us




Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.




Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.




We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes Avison Young a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for maintaining, validating, manipulating, and analyzing data and data processes within our Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), as well as our proprietary UI, AVANT. This includes the management of real estate data, as well as real estate adjacent data. Position entails daily and weekly data tasks, data sprints that support regional teams, as well as national product goals, in addition to longer term projects aimed at enhancing the platform though data. The technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing you provide to the entire Innovation & Insight Team will enable the group to provide data-driven decisions to internal stakeholders as well as external clients.




Furthermore, our system and processes are always evolving, therefore you will have a direct impact on how data is gathered, manipulated, cleansed, analyzed, and ingested, helping make strategic decisions about the future of the data.




Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization, by collaborating close with data scientists, the GIS team, the analytics team and the data architecture team
Collaborate with a network of cross-functional colleagues to help provide data-driven solutions to key stakeholders and clients.
Reviewing products daily and ensuring that core real estate data recently added to platform including properties, images, documents, companies, leases, sales, scoop and availabilities appear complete, consistent, high quality and are displaying correctly
Collaborating, growing and optimizing best-in-class daily data collection processes to consolidate data sources, utilize automated workflows and engage with local resources to capture and enhance micro real estate data on properties, companies, availabilities, leases, sales and scoop, among other data verticals
Understanding all aspects of the relationship between real estate developments, renovations, sales, tenancy/occupancy and leasing financials
Strong interest in the commercial real estate industry
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Knowledge and experience using SQL
Python and/or R is a plus
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Analytical skills to collect, organize, analyze, and understand information technically and practically
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
0-2 years professional experience within data or real estate
Bachelor’s degree in economics, computer science, data analytics, business or similar
Strong English language oral and written language skills




Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.




The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.




For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.




Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: In-office -- Englewood, CO.

Duration: Full-time

Compensation: $75K-$100K




Our client in the telecommunications space is in need of a Data Analyst to join their Training Performance Optimization team. This role focuses on collecting and delivering business insights that lead to strategies that are actionable, driving results. In this role, you will be responsible for leveraging SQL and Tableau to transform disparate, discrete data points into cohesive, digestible stories through querying, coding, data visualizations, and dashboards.







Qualifications:

Advanced background in SQL, Tableau development, AWS Google Studios, and Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel. Python and automation experience is desired
Strong communication with stakeholders both internally and externally is required
Self-motivated and the ability to work with autonomy
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and project-management skills are preferred







For immediate consideration, please send your resume to mckenzie.durham@trustpoint.one

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Location: Remote

Duration: Contract

Pay: $70-$80/hr




Description:

Candidates should be able to apply technology, example Power BI, as well as modelling tools to build working prototypes with the help of technical teams to confirm user expectations. This Candidate should be able to direct Data Engineers on implementation tasks and analyze, participate, and provide suggestions in any production support issues with Data/Analytics Engineers in problem resolution. This Candidate must be striving to improve the stability and quality of solutions, to increase customer adoption, loyalty, and reduce support. This role is also a key change management driver for successful adoption of Customer Literacy, Data Governance practices within their assigned domain.




Responsibilities:

Partners closely with finance enterprise architects and technical leaders to lead program increment sessions with business stakeholders to identify 3-6 month priorities
Ensures that plan aligns with long term strategic goals for finance capability
Define business case to help prioritize/optimize execution based on team capacity
Coordinates the Scrum Master / Project Manager and project resources to ensure that projects are delivered on time and within budget
Helps map out team-to-team dependencies and collaborates with capability teams accordingly
Improves systems and processes by studying current practices, designing modifications in partnership with stakeholders
Partners closely with Data Governance team to update metadata and data literacy content
Works with Data and Analytics Engineers to provide Level 3 support for Capability team
Well versed in Analytics and insights methodologies and tools – example: ADF, ADLS G2, Azure SQL DW, AAS, Power BI, Python, Data exploration, and mining tools
Roll the sleeves if needed to use those technologies for proof of concepts or application validations
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies
Has good understanding of application of analytics and insights to solve business outcomes
Provides consultation to our business or enterprise shared services teams
Is hands on, innovative and out of box thinker to help provide robust solutions in a timely manner
Is always striving to improve the Azure Analytics stack, methodologies, processes to drive decision intelligence

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, management information systems or related field
Must exhibit excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Understanding of the Finance processes such as General Ledger, Cost Center Accounting, Profitability Analysis etc.,
Knowledge of planning applications such as Hyperion, Enterprise Planning Management is an added advantage
Understanding of SAP transactional systems such as ECC, CRM, Hybris is desirable
Strong understanding of basic system engineering, object-oriented design, information risk and security guidelines and architecture standards
Knowledge in software design, documentation, development process and software requirements
Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and changing business requirements
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to understand business functionality and translate it into application requirements
Ability to create compelling business cases with accurate cost and effort estimations
Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies
Intellectual curiosity and the ability to question thought partners across functional areas
Ability to partner with multiple stakeholders and influence project decisions
Understanding of the various software development lifecycles (e.g., Agile, Waterfall, etc.)
Understanding of finance would be helpful in this role; the more finance in their background the better fit they’ll be

Category Code: JN008

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary: Our client is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join their hybrid team in Chicago, IL. The client is revamping their cybersecurity protocols surrounding their application vulnerabilities to identify and remediate current and future risk/threat potentials. So, the Data Analyst’s responsibility is to identify in datasets any and all vulnerabilities, risks, threats to all applications. They will analyze, clean, and build reports from data to identify areas of potential vulnerabilities/threats to applications. They will provide findings to the project team(s) to build and execute solutions to remediate those threats.




Duties:

Collect, transform, and interpret large data sets
Pull, clean and analyze data from various databases, systems and platforms monitoring the performance and health of utilized applications
Build functions in Excel
Maintain proficiency in Excel and running functions
Visualize and create visualizations for individuals




​​​​​​​Desired Skills/Experience:

Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel (VLOOKUPs, HLOOKUPs, and the ability to quickly clean and merge large data sets)
Ability to write own function and macros to clean large data sets
Ability to extract business value from the information they are seeing for the business user
Experience with visualization tools such as Spotfire, Tableau, PowerBI
Cybersecurity experience (preferred)
Qualys, Vericode experience (preferred)




Benefits:

Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance Plans
401K offered

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You’ll Be Doing:




Our Torq Insights practice is looking for superstars who will fill a key role by working with our clients to support all aspects of analytic initiatives from conception to completion. Your passion, knowledge and confidence will fuel a powerful experience that drives meaningful impact for our clients. Below are some of the key things you’ll need to excel in:




Build strong relationships with customer organization team members and cross-functional partners to provide strategic advice on data trends and requirements.
Be intellectually curious and have a passion for proactively digging into data
Develop KPIs and metrics within interactive visualizations that allow stakeholders to easily process and take action.
Simplify data into a compelling story that will be presented to stakeholders, including high-level executives and leaders.
Lead in all aspects of the BI lifecycle from gathering requirements to data validation, data analysis, report analysis, and understanding of business processes.
Account for the overall management of analytic projects; including timeliness, quality, and client value; QA/QC data and report outputs to ensure accuracy.
Promote data literacy and a self-serve culture across the enterprise through training & coaching business users on BI tools.




What You’ll Bring to the Table:




Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Information Management, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or related discipline
2 to 3 years of applied experience in Consulting, Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, or a related field
Ability to manage in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders
Strong quantitative, analytical, and conceptual problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to analyze data and develop visualizations that lead actionable insight
Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization tools
Experience with SQL or other querying languages




Bonus Skills (not required but a plus!)




Web Analytics and Tagging platforms like Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics a plus
Python, R, SAS, or statistical analytics tools
Data Governance and Master Data Management standards and frameworks, specifically Informatica




Benefits And Other Fun Stuff




We ask our consultants to be superstars, so we treat them like it. Even better, our perks are designed for employees by our employees. We do this because we believe in delivering a compelling benefits package that puts you at the heart of our rewards.




Competitive Salary – your bank account will be smiling
Unlimited PTO – we’re serious about that work-life balance thing
Best-in-class health/vision/dental benefits – your health is our priority
Generous 401K options – take care of your future with us
Opportunity to be a key player at a highly reputable, fast-growing consulting firm
High degree of internal mobility and diverse project opportunities




Torq is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.




Note: No visa sponsorship is available for this position, all applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.

  • Build strong relationships with customer organization team members and cross-functional partners to provide strategic advice on data trends and requirements.
  • Be intellectually curious and have a passion for proactively digging into data
  • Develop KPIs and metrics within interactive visualizations that allow stakeholders to easily process and take action.
  • Simplify data into a compelling story that will be presented to stakeholders, including high-level executives and leaders.
  • Lead in all aspects of the BI lifecycle from gathering requirements to data validation, data analysis, report analysis, and understanding of business processes.
  • Account for the overall management of analytic projects; including timeliness, quality, and client value; QA/QC data and report outputs to ensure accuracy.
  • Promote data literacy and a self-serve culture across the enterprise through training & coaching business users on BI tools.


What You’ll Bring to the Table:


  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Information Management, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or related discipline
  • 2 to 3 years of applied experience in Consulting, Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, or a related field
  • Ability to manage in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders
  • Strong quantitative, analytical, and conceptual problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze data and develop visualizations that lead actionable insight
  • Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization tools
  • Experience with SQL or other querying languages


Bonus Skills (not required but a plus!)


  • Web Analytics and Tagging platforms like Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics a plus
  • Python, R, SAS, or statistical analytics tools
  • Data Governance and Master Data Management standards and frameworks, specifically Informatica


Benefits And Other Fun Stuff


We ask our consultants to be superstars, so we treat them like it. Even better, our perks are designed for employees by our employees. We do this because we believe in delivering a compelling benefits package that puts you at the heart of our rewards.


  • Competitive Salary – your bank account will be smiling
  • Unlimited PTO – we’re serious about that work-life balance thing
  • Best-in-class health/vision/dental benefits – your health is our priority
  • Generous 401K options – take care of your future with us
  • Opportunity to be a key player at a highly reputable, fast-growing consulting firm
  • High degree of internal mobility and diverse project opportunities


Torq is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.


  • Note: No visa sponsorship is available for this position, all applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.

Title: Data Analyst-Entry level.

Responsibilities




Work hand-in-hand with the business side of an organization to help in process improvement.




Working primarily on design and analysis in the areas of organization, planning cum information technology.




Works as the middle man between the technical team and business team so as to assist in the development of requirements needed for the business.




He/ She will be responsible for documenting customer requirements as outlined by the business users.




The analyst’s role also includes making sure that the designs meet the company’s technical standards.




Qualification And Experience




Entry Level / Fresh Graduates / Engineers - BS / MS in Business/Data Analytics, Management Information systems, Computer Science ,Software engineering, IT, Industrial Engineering/Engineering management.
Prior experience is a "plus" but not required.
Candidates with strong communication/presentation skills, strong aptitude to learn and interest in Software programming, Testing or Business Analysis.
Work Authorization: Must be authorized to work in the US.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description Will work with the management team to design and maintain effective reporting, analyses and presentation of performance data. The successful candidate will be able to listen to business needs and create systems to identify and track business trends across multiple systems and put them all together. The data analyst will provide regular performance and production information in detailed format for internal review and analysis and in dashboard form for stakeholder review and overview.

Responsibilities

Acquires and presents data from all collected data sources
Designs and schedules reports in Chronicall, Crystal Reports and additional proprietary software
Develops and implements data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Works with management team and board staff to develop and implement automated quality control plans
Monitors performance and quality control plans to identify areas for improvement and reports exceptions
Develops measurement plans and dashboards, monitors metrics
Collaborates with management team on ad-hoc analysis to uncover root cause of trends to help predict future resource needs
Responds to management requests to extract data, design and produce reports

Required Skills

Expertise with SQL queries and Crystal Reports Designer
Proven work experience as a data analyst
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets
Experience with the following preferred: Excel, Crystal Reports, Crystal Dashboard, MSSAQL, SSRS, Chronicall, DocuWare and Relational Database Management Systems
Professional certification: MCSA: SQL would be a plus
Excellent written, verbal skills and math skills

BS in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics. Equivalent experience in addition to relevant certifications may be used in lieu of degree.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
** LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY**




Position Overview:

We are looking for a motivated, organized, and analytical thinker to join our Operations Team. The ideal candidate must be comfortable corresponding daily on the phone and through professional emails with people in municipal departments. You must have strong attention to detail, communication, and reading comprehension skills. You must be results driven, growth oriented, and able to balance multiple projects at any given time. You must be able to think quickly and be an active problem solver. If you are experienced with real estate taxes, assessment, valuation, or real estate in general – this is the role for you!




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

● Engage in daily phone and email correspondence to obtain information from government bodies across the country as well as foster working relationships with those people

● Engage in persistent and professional follow-up with necessary parties and maintain working relationships

● Review, analyze, and archive meta-data points from commercial contracts, public records, and information gathered from correspondence with government bodies

● Search public records and online databases for property information, building permits, tax bills, and information related to clients and contracts

● Participate with executive Management Team on company growth strategy

● Prepare and present reports and to the Management Team

● Be a direct support to our Sales Team

● Be creative and have an analytical thinking mentality

● Work collaboratively with all departments to reach company targets

● Participate in regular training and success meetings




Qualifications:

● ● Bachelor’s degree or appropriate job-related experience

● Minimum of 2 years’ professional experience with a preference to those within the commercial real estate industry or experience with property assessments and/or real estate taxes (New college graduates with applicable Intern or co-op experience may be considered)

● Confident and comfortable speaking with others by phone/email

● Able to work independently as well as in a team environment

● Experience with research and data analysis

● Basic skills in Excel and Microsoft Office applications

● Strong organizational, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

● Proven project management skills and experience handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy.

● Professional demeanor with a high degree of business acumen

● Creative, persistent, fast learner, and quick thinker - Problem Solver Mentality

● Must be able to handle rejection and overcome work obstacles




Compensation:

Commensurate with experience. Competitive Benefits Package including: 100% paid health insurance, dental, and vision coverage. Flexible Time Off and 401K contribution.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Reference #




269076BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you an analytical data expert who has the technical skills to solve complex problems – and the curiosity to explore what problems need to be solved? Are you part mathematician, part computer scientist, part program manager and part trend-spotter? Do you like to play between both the business and IT worlds? Do you use technology-driven processes, technologies, and architectures that convert raw data into actionable information which drives informed/profitable actions. Are you interested in AML (Anti Money Laundering) and how to apply data science to solve some of the world’s most complex problems?




Do you think about big data as a gold mine that unearths business insights and transforms how decisions are made. Do you apply scientific methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights from noisy, structured and unstructured data, and apply knowledge from data across a broad range of application domains. To you look at complex issues and break them down to their core elements?




Are you a skilled Project manager, skilled at planning, executing and completing projects from initiation, planning, execution, monitoring to control and closure?




We are looking for a Data Analyst who can:





enable effective and efficient compliance with new or changing regulations, develop and propose changes to reporting, data management (including metadata management and data access technologies), processes, products, etc.
handle business wide reporting - Prepare, design, and develop reporting tools, targeting senior management audience with data gathering and modeling strategies.
conduct system wide audits to ensure a high level of scrutiny, accuracy, and efficiency to evaluate and mitigate business and sector risk.
introduce process improvement steps and controls throughout the reporting process, while maintaining the integrity of the data.
track progress against agreed remediation deadlines and actively manage key support areas to monitor and escalate issues.





Project Coordination and Management:





manage all aspects of regulatory change projects, including project planning, reporting, execution, timing, quality, cost, risks, resources and overall project governance.
work closely with and establish effective communication channels with key stakeholders, SME's and clients to gather project requirements, specifications and limitations in order to develop state of the art reporting capabilities.
communicate effectively across all levels of the organization, with ability to influence and challenge key decision makers, peer groups, internal service providers and functions outside direct control





Your team




We are a team within Wealth Management USA that supports the COO organization. This role is across all the US Lines of business (CUSO wide)




Your expertise





statistical analysis and reporting, process reengineering
develop forecasting models and other analytics
Data preparation: the process of converting raw data into another format so it can be more easily consumed.
Text analytics: the process of examining unstructured data to glean key business insights.
Data visualization: analyze current and historical data and presents findings in easy-to-digest reports, dashboards, graphs, charts, and maps that can be shared
Program management, ownership, and entrepreneurism





Software applications and programming languages: SQL, Python, MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio), SharePoint, and Tableau.




About Us




UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?




Disclaimer / Policy Statements




UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.




Your Career Comeback




We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Global Hires is looking for an ALL-STAR Data Analyst for our client in the packaging industry. Their mission is to collaboratively craft innovative, high-quality packaging solutions that balance the needs of their clients with the ever-evolving needs of their consumers. Caring for their business also means the internal teams are equally important - physical & mental health, integrity, team collaboration and sustainability!




The organization knows that data is the foundation to making smart decisions and requests an ALL-STAR Data Analyst to identify and communicate data-driven insights to maximize efficient operations and other initiatives. You will turn raw data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions.




The ideal team member should be passionate about finding insights in large datasets, synthesizing, and communicating results to drive business results and growth. You will work cross-functionally with Product Management, Engineering, Plant Quality, Sales, and Finance Departments. This position requires successful candidate to be a self-starter, managing and providing consistent and reliable reporting and analysis, in addition to utilizing primary and secondary research methods.




This role is an onsite, full-time position based out of the Modesto, CA office.




Job Functions & Core Responsibilities:

Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code patterns.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets.
Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources and maintain databases and data systems.
Provide analytical, statistical, and programming to identify key market trends focused on insights, user growth and content by performing market and competitive analyses.
Work with the management team to prioritize business data and information needs.
Monitor performance and quality controls plans to identify improvements.
Perform other tasks as assigned.




Skills:

Technical expertise regarding data models, databases design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of reporting packages (business objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (SML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Strong knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analyzing datasets using visualization tools such as Python, R, Excel, and Tableau.
Extensive knowledge of programming language.
Strong data analytic skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of raw data into reports.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
High attention to detail and accuracy.
Creative and critical thinking skills.
Strong problem-solving, presentation and graphical skills.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required.
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Great interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.




Education/Experience & Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Information Technology, or related field required.
Master’s degree in Analytics or Data Science preferred.
3-5 years proven work experience as a data analyst or business data analyst.
Proven experience in data extraction, data cleaning, data loading, statistical data analysis, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling.
Experience using SPSS, SAS, Power BI, and Tableau.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Coriell Institute for Medical Research is currently seeking an energetic and organized Data Analyst to join our IT team and successfully support a wide variety of projects in support of our biobanking operations. The successful applicant will merge, process, clean, validate and make available data and data reports collected for biobanking efforts at Coriell, including demographic data, clinical data, sample processing data, sample inventory data, and sample distribution data for thousands of participants.

The successful applicant will have 3-5 years of experience with data management, data cleaning, and data processing in a scientific environment. In particular, three years of SQL Server and R programming experience and experience in maintaining source code in code repository tools are desired. Experience with Shiny is a plus. Applicants should also have excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to interface with an interdisciplinary team of IT professionals, scientists, and support staff.

If you are interested in applying for this opportunity, please email a cover letter and resume to careers@coriell.org. Please note, the cover letter must include a detailed description of your relevant experience as well as highlight your applicable background.

Founded in 1953, the Coriell Institute for Medical Research is a nonprofit research institute dedicated to improving human health through biomedical research. Coriell scientists lead research in personalized medicine, cancer biology, epigenetics, and the genomics of opioid use disorder. Coriell also hosts one of the world's leading biobanks—comprised of collections for the National Institutes of Health, disease foundations and private clients—and distributes biological samples and offers research and biobanking services to scientists around the globe. To facilitate drug discovery and disease study, the Institute also develops and distributes collections of induced pluripotent stem cells. To learn more, visit www.coriell.org. EOE

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*This is a 6 Month Contract-To-Hire role available to US Citizens and Green Card holders ONLY*




Overview

3+ years' experience as a data analyst or technical business analyst that is data savvy

Experience analyzing Direct to Consumer data

Experience creating use cases

Ability to create SQL queries from scratch to pull data from multiple sources

Familiar with any type of cloud (Snowflake preferred)




Nice to Have

Past experience working on Streaming Services

Experience creating dashboards in Tableau




Day-to-Day

Insight global is looking for a Technical Business Analyst to sit in LA for a large media company. This company is ramping up their direct-to-consumer organization and needs more help with various projects. This person will be joining the Business Intelligence and Engineering team for the company's DTC (direct-to-consumer) streaming platform. The Technical Business Analyst will work alongside Sr. Data Architects, Data Engineers and Reporting Analysts who will be doing the heavy lifting in the data. This analyst will need strong communication experience as they will be presenting weekly reports to stakeholders.




A day to day percentage breakdown is as followed:

* 90% pulling data using SQL queries made from scratch

* 10% gathering requirements from stakeholders (data engineering team and marketing team_

An example of a requirement this analyst may receive from the business is a Marketing or product revenue use case on creating a user graph. The Marketing team would request the analyst to run a campaign for all the users between 2 different systems (ex: user A exists in NBC and user 1 exists in Peacock) Marketing team wants to know if user A and user 1 are the same? The analyst would need to understand all the identifiers such as what shows they watch, where they are located, how long they're watching the show for, etc in order for them to pull the applicable data. Based on this analysis, the analyst will decide why users from Peacock are not users of NBC's platforms and vice versa. For example, a new advertising campaign from Peacock pulled users from Netflix or Hulu instead of an NBC platform.

Show more Show less

3+ years' experience as a data analyst or technical business analyst that is data savvy

Experience analyzing Direct to Consumer data

Experience creating use cases

Ability to create SQL queries from scratch to pull data from multiple sources

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst, Sales Analytics

US Remote

$100-120k




This is a great opportunity to join a leading broker of customer acquisition services as a Senior Data Analyst. The company helps clients grow through in-person marketing and sales campaigns.




The Senior Analyst would play a key role in supporting sales analysis across multiple campaigns and requires strong skills in data validation, research, and reconciliation.




ROLE OVERVIEW – SENIOR DATA ANALYST

Work closely with executives and business leaders to provide analysis related to revenue and costs
Validate and manage multifaceted data sets
Deliver clear and concise reports and analysis
Generate, maintain and monitor reporting around key metrics
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Work as a key contact with clients to acquire data, dispute payments, and resolve discrepancies
Identify, research, and resolve missing orders, inaccurate payments, incomplete data, and any other issues that arise

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Quantitative degree and ideally 2+ years’ experience in a data analysis role where you have worked with sales data
Strong Excel skills are a must! Salesforce and Tableau knowledge is highly preferred
Experience validating, troubleshooting and analyzing large volumes of data
Ability to break down complex analysis into easily digestible reports
Be a critical thinker with a problem-solving approach
Prior track record of automating processes via modeling and use of Excel
Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills
Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with C-Suite

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finexio is the leader in AP Payments as a Service, the leading embedded payments approach for business the business payments. Finexio simplifies the way businesses process and receive B2B payments by integrating electronic payments and cash flow improvement solutions directly into customers’ accounts payable and procurement software.

Our vision is a world in which finance leaders only have to decide “what” to pay- Finexio’s software seamlessly handles the “how” and the “when”.




We are growing 250+% per year and are a leading disruptor in the B2B Payments and Fintech industry. The company has raised over $65m in investment and is backed by investors JP Morgan, Discover, NBH Bank, Mendon Venture Partners,




The Data Analyst brings advanced analysis, modeling and performance measurement on projects across the company. Clear on the purpose of data, how to capture, manipulate, interpret and apply it, they demonstrate the value and impact of this sophisticated science to inform client behaviors and activities.




Responsibilities:

Perform complex company, customer and sales analysis from gathering requirements, performing the analysis and providing actionable insights and recommendations to the business
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Work closely with data analysts and data engineering team to implement and refine data architecture it on an ongoing basis
Identify opportunities to initiate new analysis that create a positive impact on the business
Develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders and earn their trust to challenge the status quo together by telling stories with data, both visually and verbally
Work with data engineering team to define, restructure and enable company-wide use of reporting tools (i.e. Looker, Power BI, etc.)
Work with team leaders at all levels to solve complex problems across the organization, develop recommendations, and present to executive leadership
Work closely across all departments to improve our reporting and self-service dashboards.




Requirements

Preferred degree with a specialization in Statistics, Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, or another quantitative field or equivalent
Mastery of SQL, Python, and other scripting/automation techniques
2-3 years proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Experience with Looker and writing in LookML
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail and data quality, incisive thinking, nuanced stakeholder engagement, team-oriented, and passion for growing a business
Your ability to think strategically, with a strong focus on details and accuracy, and the flexibility necessary to collaborate effectively with cross-functionally is critical to succeeding in this position
Comfort with adapting and adjusting to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid change




Benefits

Why You’ll Love Working at Finexio:

Culture: We are a humble, client-first team that is focused on collaborative data-driven success.
Speed: We move fast, love new ideas and give you the opportunity to push your limits.
Growth: We are expanding rapidly into new markets, launching new services and creating a world-class company.

What We Offer:

The opportunity to work in a fast-growth start-up environment with experienced industry leaders.
Blue chip client and partner base.
Competitive salary and stock options.
Medical, dental, and vision starting on your first day.
Unlimited vacation policy.




$100k -130k base + Equity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?




At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.




Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.




ANALYTICS




What We Do




Our Data & Analytics teams build powerful stories and visuals that inform the games we make, the technology we develop, and business decisions that drive Epic.




What You'll Do




We're looking for a Sr. QA Data Analyst to help drive more data-driven decision making. You’ll be the primary point of contact in maintaining informational dashboards and working with leads and managers to develop metrics based on available data. You’ll develop effective queries within Jira and Test Rail to help establish historic metrics, then develop trending reports to highlight risks and opportunities for the QA organization. You will use your experience with test coverage to develop effective communication with developers and production on key performance indicators..




In This Role You Will




Use a blend of testing skills and data analytics, develop a holistic view of the state of QA testing, end to end across all of Epic’s products.
Understand how and what we are testing, how effective our testing efforts are, and what types of tests meaningfully change the health of our products
Translate large amounts of data into easily understable reports or dashboard so that decisions can be made on how to move forward within development.
Dig into jira to understand trends of work output and timelines on individual teams
Assess defect data tied to specific sub categories within products per release
Work with stakeholders at the senior leadership level, team leaders, as well as contributors on individual teams.




What We're Looking For




2 years working in data analytics
Practical knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle
Ability to define and spot macro and micro levels trends with statistical significance on a regular basis and understand key drivers impacting those trends
Data analyst experience in a large scale environment
Proven results oriented analysis that helped support positive change in the business strategy
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Data Science or related experience required
Experience in Python, R, SQL, Tableau, Google Analytics, Tableau, or PowerBI




About Us




Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.




Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!




Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Trillium, an Optibus company, provides web-based software and consulting services that enables better communication between public transportation agencies and customers. Our core service is GTFS Manager, web-based software to manage GTFS data for trip planning and other applications.




Trillium is searching for a Data Analyst who will be at the front line of Trillium’s customer support and data management branch. You will create and manage GTFS Data, handle customer requests and tickets, and maintain Trillium’s internal databases




Responsibilities

Working as part of a team of data Analysts to input and edit public transportation data
Responding to client queries regarding the use of browser-based software through an online support desk, email, and occasionally phone calls or webinars
Assisting our website team with triaging client requests
Assisting our development team in testing software updates as requested
Comfortable with computers and learning new technologies
A discerning eye for details and a commitment to high-quality work products
Excited about our mission to make public transit easier to access
A desire to learn and grow with us




Other Qualifications

These are qualifications that would be beneficial to this job. However, if you are excited about the position and only meet the required qualifications, you should go ahead and apply.




Writing and research experience
Previous experience with public transit
Software-testing experience
Experience with ZenDesk or GitHub
Experience working remotely




Working Mode




This is a full time position. Space is always available at our downtown Portland office, and we support flexible working; but most of our staff work about half time from their homes. We are open to a national remote hire, with a preference for Portland, DC, and Indianapolis.




Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion




Trillium is an Optibus Company. Trillium’s office is ADA accessible. We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet all of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. We are committed to providing the right candidate with the on-the-job training and support necessary to be successful in this position.




Equal Opportunity




Optibus.com is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, cultural background, religious beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Title: Data Analyst (part-time)
Description:
About Upbeat

Upbeat works with K-12 districts across the country to administer a research-grounded survey to elevate teacher engagement and retention by fostering strong school environments. Founded and led by former educators, we bring together data scientists, technologists, and experienced former school leaders to deliver a research-backed solution. Our surveys paired with tailored toolkits and intervention strategies surface real-time insights so that principals and district leaders are able to better understand and uncover the conditions affecting employee morale and establish actionable plans to improve teacher and staff retention.




Job Responsibilities




Data Analysis
Conduct complex quantitative data analysis in Stata
Collaborate on scholarly articles and writing policy memos and grant applications
Managing elements of large-scale research projects
Analyze the relationships among teacher engagement scores on the Upbeat survey and other key variables including teacher retention, student achievement, and equity outcomes
Coordinate the appropriate study design, sample and methods for data analysis studies
Collect, clean and analyze data
Support validation of new and current surveys
Data Systems Design
Organize the backend database to properly capture customers’ retention data
Assist with implementation strategies to ensure accuracy in data collection




Qualifications

B.A. / M.A. and or Ph.D. in data science or applied social science
Skills in quantitative data analysis and program evaluation
Advanced proficiency in Stata and/or R
Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaborate in a team environment
Excellent communication skills and attention to detail
Ability to manage and complete complex projects by navigating multiple workstreams and achieving specified outcomes
Comfort learning and operating in-house administrative tools (e.g., for customer management, survey administration etc.)
Intermediate to advanced proficiency with Google Sheets / Microsoft Excel
Ability to identify / recommend opportunities for product enhancement based on findings
Experience in education or education policy is a plus 




*Compensation starts at $60/hour

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SmartSource is seeking a Data Analyst for a direct hire opportunity that is 60% on site, 40% remote.




Please Note: This is a direct hire opportunity and not a contract. Only considering local candidates. Before applying for the opportunity, please make sure you read the job details entirely.




Overview:

The The ideal candidate will have the ability to constantly improve business and our clients’ business, be forward thinking about the future of unchartered possibilities, inclined to vocalize his/her own views and ideas and be a thought leader in exploring new technologies. In addition, this candidate will be required to maintain existing dashboards, and create new dashboards if needed.




Responsibilities:

Modify and improve existing reports for internal and external clients.
Author and publish reports in Power BI from a variety of data sources.
Technically and securely onboard new clients and their data to BI platform.
Support executive teams to create visualizations for operational and financial KPI’s.
Partner with and communicate with stakeholders at all organizational levels.
Conduct technical sales demonstrations as a subject matter technical expert, with the ability to present offering and capabilities of our products and services.
Troubleshoot issues with Power BI Gateway, such as data refreshes.
Working knowledge of data warehouse, SQL, and python.
Extract data from customer Transportation Management Systems (TMS), as well as other relevant feeds and databases.
Software sourcing and vetting.
Additional duties and projects as assigned.




Required Qualifications:

3-5 years’ experience in business intelligence and data strategy.
Prefer 3-5 years of consulting, or professional experience in a in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.
Ability to write and understand complex DAX expressions in Power BI. DA-100 preferred.
Understanding of multidimensional data models.
Demonstrated understanding of relational databases and SQL queries within Azure.




Preferred Qualifications:

TMW, Ascend, or other Transportation Management Solutions training, a plus.
Comfortable with variety of assignments and projects.
Superior ability to prioritize, multitask and problem solve.
Ability to work in a team environment while delivering independent results.
Strong communication skills, and ability to communicate to all levels of the organization.
High attention to detail and strong organization skills.
Strong communication skills, and ability to communicate to all levels of the organization.
Strong commitment to providing a best-in-class user experience.
Flexibility to travel to client meetings, between offices, and be available outside of standard business hours.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

20-month Contract

Our telecommunications partner located in Charlotte, NC is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Mass Markets Systems team within the TSA (Transition Services Agreement) group. You will work with cross-functional teams to drive Data Analytics and Business Intelligence for overall process improvement, specifically related to ETL processes. In this role you will demonstrate your love for learning and problem solving, and the ability to analyze and deliver valuable business analytics.




Job Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Analyze and interpret ETL processes
Create and maintain technical documentation for data models and data pipelines
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Make process changes based on what is derived from the data analytics
Collaborate with other teams to ensure data accuracy and integrity
This role requires a candidate who is self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. The ideal candidate will have a passion for working with data and a desire to learn new technologies.




Job Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in data analysis and data warehousing
Proficient in SQL
Proficient in BigQuery
Proficient with data visualization tools such as Looker or PowerBI
Experience with Oracle or Teradata is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience presenting analytical findings on meetings with internal and external stakeholders
Experience giving process improvement recommendations based on analytical findings
Data conversion or system/application conversion/migration experience is a huge plus
Experience working in the Telecom industry is a plus
